Package org.agilewiki.utils.virtualcow

Virtual AA Trees are an alternative to B Trees for creating scalable data structures.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Transaction
    A transaction simply transforms a map list.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BlockReference
    Holds a block number, block length and checksum.
    BlockReferenceFactory
    Defines how a BlockReference is serialized / deserialized.
    Db
    A database that supports multiple blocks.
    DbFactoryRegistry
    Initialize the factory registry.
    Timestamp
    Generates a unique timestamp, up to 1024 per millisecond.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    BlockSizeTooLarge
    Thrown when creating a block that is larger than the max block size.
    DulicateOpenException
    Thrown when opening the already open database.
    FileDoesNotExistExcpetion
    Thrown when trying to open a file that does not exist.
    FileNotReadableException
    Thrown when trying to open an unreadable file.
    FileNotRegularExcpetion
    Thrown when trying to open a file that is not a regular file.
    FileNotWritableException
    Thrown when trying to open an unwritable file.
    MaxBlockSizeTooSmallException
    Thrown when the max block size is too small.
    PrivilegedOperationException
    Thrown when a privileged operation is attenpted outside of a transaction.
    UnexpectedChecksumException
    Thrown when a block is read with a checksum that differs from what was expected.

Package org.agilewiki.utils.virtualcow Description

Virtual AA Trees are an alternative to B Trees for creating scalable data structures.
